plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous flowering cherry tree known for its stunning and abundant pink to white blossoms that create iconic spring landscapes in Japan and other temperate regions.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China) and temperate zones worldwide
plants.funFact: The Japanese cherry blossom is celebrated annually in festivals called 'Hanami' where people gather to appreciate transient beauty and the arrival of spring.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A popular hybrid magnolia tree characterized by large, cup-shaped flowers that appear before the leaves, displaying shades of white, pink, and purple.
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolias bloom on old wood, so heavy pruning can reduce flowering in the spring.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with striking clusters of flowers ranging from white to pink to red, often blooming prolifically in Mediterranean climates and subtropical areas.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, southern USA, and other subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested but has been used traditionally in folk medicine and for ornamental purposes.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A native Australian tree producing cylindrical yellow flower spikes that attract nectar-feeding birds and mammals during the southern hemisphere's early spring.
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers are arranged in dense cylindrical spikes containing hundreds of small individual flowers.
